title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 30 March 2016 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <vmassol> XWIKI-7623  
12:22 <vmassol> hmm this bot is completely broken…. I need to look at it...  
12:29 <vmassol> fixing build  
12:48 <gayashan> has quit  
12:51 <lkrejci> has quit  
12:51 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
12:58 <tmortagne> has quit  
13:02 <Pbas> has quit  
13:12 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
13:23 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:49 <vmassol> evalica: ping  
13:49 <evalica> y  
13:49 <vmassol> see skype  
13:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: when we build XE, it's using the XWikiPreferences from platform-distribution?  
14:02 <slestak> has joined #xwiki  
14:04 <tmortagne> vmassol: since 8.0 yes XWikiPreferences come from XWiki distribution  
14:04 <vmassol> ok  
14:04 <tmortagne> but XE modify it (during build) for subwikis I think  
14:04 <vmassol> hmmm  
14:04 <vmassol> ok  
14:04 <tmortagne> checking  
14:04 <vmassol> I'm replacing a panel there  
14:04 <vmassol> I guess I need to only make the modification in one place  
14:05 <vmassol> (the dsitribution flavor module)  
14:05 <tmortagne> yes that's it, it's the same for main wiki and it's modified during build for subwikis  
14:05 <tmortagne> yes I would do the change on XWiki platform flavor  
14:06 <vmassol> the build for subwikis is using the XWiki platform flavor  I guess  
14:06 <tmortagne> yes  
14:06 <vmassol> ok  
14:06 <tmortagne> the only XWikiPreference.xml file I known in in platform flavor in other words  
14:07 <tmortagne> XWikiPreferences.xml  
14:08 <slestak> good morning guys.  is there a mapping that occurs between the db table xwikiproperties and the file webapps\xwiki\WEB-INF\xwiki.properties in enterprise v8.0?  
14:08 <slestak> i have changes that are appearign in sql that are not in the properties file.  if it is permissions issue it is failign silently.  
14:09 <cjd> Good morning, xwikiproperties is a table for containing the properties of all of the objects attached to all of the objects in the wiki so it does not have anything to do with xwiki.properties configuration file  
14:09 <slestak> ahh  
14:09 <cjd> \*attached to all the documents in the ...  
14:11 <cjd> xwiki.properties is somehow related to the document XWiki.XWikiPreferences but you really need to only access that document from inside of the wiki, it's quite inaccessable from the database shell directly  
14:11 <slestak> i installed the ldap control panel extension, and it constantly tells me that ldap is not enabled as an auth method (which it is enabled in xwiki.cfg) and properties I have set regarding ldap settings are in the db, but are not being written to disk  
14:11 <cjd> Unfortunately I'm not the guy for LDAP  
14:12 <slestak> i am running tomcat 8 on server 2102 r2 with sqlserver datastore.  if i was deploying on linux do you think xwiki would detect if the cfg file was not writable by the servlet container?  
14:12 <slestak> ive looked pretty closely at the tomcat logs and xwiki is not emmiting any errors  
14:13 <cjd> config file should not need to be writable but it certainly must be readable  
14:13 <slestak> this all worked well with jetty and hsql but i am trying to deploy with tomcat + apache  
14:13 <slestak> i will reach out to the developer of the ldap admin extension  
14:14 <slestak> love the project, ty guys for your work  
14:17 <cjd> If you're looking to help out development and get a nice easy installation, you might look at buying a few days of development time from XWiki SAS or Softec in order to get your system all setup the way you want...  
14:17 <cjd> (these are companies who sponsor XWiki development)  
14:18 <slestak> i wish i could.  my companies margins are so small im am lucky currently to get a keyboard approved  
14:18 <vmassol> :)  
14:19 <slestak> i will certainly contribute in any way i can, and teach them the value of FOSS  
14:19 <cjd> Yeap, it's an exciting time to be alive but a tricky time to be in business  
14:37 <mflorea> has quit  
14:37 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
14:52 <slestak> found the issue.  do you know the acronym pebcak?  
14:53 <slestak> problem exist between chair and keyboard.  twas a typo.  
15:01 <vmassol> :)  
15:14 <gayashan> has joined #xwiki  
15:19 <Pbas> I see... someone talking about me (or my cat, it depend)?  
15:21 <lkrejci> has quit  
15:21 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
15:22 <slestak> no, i was claiming to be the source of the error.  
15:22 <Pbas> yep me to, previously :-)  
15:26 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
15:29 <slestak> interesting.  on win10, editor does not launch completely in firefox.  works well in IE11 and chrome  
15:29 <msmeria> has quit  
15:30 <slestak> works in Edge also.  
15:34 <slestak> checkign from another workstation to see if it is consistent  
15:50 <lkrejci> has quit  
15:51 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
15:51 <vmassol> has quit  
15:52 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:54 <slestak> firefox 45.0.1 on win7 editor spawns fine.  same version on win10 pro doesnt launch  
15:54 <slestak> gonna reboot brb  
15:54 <slestak> has quit  
16:03 <acotiuga> has quit  
16:03 <gayashan> has quit  
16:04 <mflorea1> has quit  
16:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
16:10 <fitz> has joined #xwiki  
16:18 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
16:21 <msmeria1> has quit  
16:22 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
16:22 <msmeria> has quit  
16:35 <woshilapin> has quit  
16:37 <rstandy> has joined #xwiki  
16:37 <rstandy> hello everyone  
16:39 <rstandy> I'm running an installation of XWiki version 7.4.1 with Postgresql 9.5 on Cenots 7.2 and java 1.8.0\_66  
16:39 <rstandy> and I'm having trouble with the "Export as PDF" functionality  
16:40 <rstandy> When clicking on the pdf export button, the page stalls until I receive a Server error and a Java Thread consumes 100% of the CPU  
16:42 <rstandy> I don't know where to look at to find the problem  
16:44 <rstandy> any idea of where to look at to try to understand the problem?  
17:06 <vmassol> hi rstandy  
17:06 <vmassol> is that a particularly big page?  
17:06 <vmassol> maybe the jvm doesn't have enough memory?  
17:07 <vmassol> I also remember that the first pdf export is longer than all the subsequent ones  
17:13 <rstandy> hi vmassol  
17:13 <rstandy> no also for very short pages  
17:14 <rstandy> for example the default Welcome sub-page of the Home page  
17:15 <rstandy> which is a few lines of text  
17:15 <vmassol> rstandy: how much memory do you give to your jvm?  
17:15 <vmassol> are you using tomcat and default memory settings?  
17:16 <vmassol> (if so you could check http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationTomcat#HOutOfMemoryError )  
17:16 <Pbas> Hello, I remember some pdf export problem when no space left on disk or wrong right access on file system (rtf export must be tested)  
17:16 <tmortagne> I don't think you can even start XWiki with default Tomcat settings  
17:16 <rstandy> this is my CATALINA\_OPTS env var:  
17:16 <rstandy> CATALINA\_OPTS=-server -Dfile.encoding=utf-8 -Xms800m -Xmx1480m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Djava.awt.headless=true -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=100  
17:16 <vmassol> ok sounds good enough  
17:16 <rstandy> yes I copied some of those params from the XWiki docs  
17:17 <vmassol> so you"re trying to export http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Welcome right?  
17:17 <vmassol> just tested it locally on hsqldb/jetty and it took 1s to export in PDF  
17:17 <vmassol> (ftr)  
17:18 <rstandy> yes, except for the /xwiki/ path, because I dropped  XWiki servlet in the ROOT dir of Tomcat  
17:19 <vmassol> one thing that could help would be to issue a sigkill to get a thread dump and see what thread is working hard  
17:19 <vmassol> as Pbas suggested, you have enough disk space right?  
17:19 <rstandy> I'll try it right now  
17:20 <rstandy> I'm creating a new sub-wiki  
17:20 <lkrejci> has quit  
17:20 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
17:21 <rstandy> just to be sure that now custom wiki pages altered the PDF export functionality  
17:24 <vmassol> ok  
17:24 <ol-ow2> has quit  
17:25 <rstandy> uhm a kill -9 <pid> killed  a thread but a new CPU sucking thread  spawned  
17:27 <rstandy> this is the url after selecting some options  
17:27 <rstandy> https://xwiki-test.local/wiki/wikitest/export/Main/Welcome?format=pdf&pdfcover=1&pdfcover=0&pdftoc=1&pdftoc=0&comments=0&attachments=0  
17:28 <rstandy> strange query string params  
17:31 <slestak> has joined #xwiki  
17:32 <rstandy> uhm sorry I had to inform you that I'm using tomcat behind apache2  
17:32 <rstandy> maybe it's better to try to contact tomcat directly  
17:34 <vmassol> rstandy: the query string looks ok  
17:34 <vmassol> hmmm  
17:34 <vmassol> except the duplicates  
17:34 <vmassol> but in any case it shouldn't affect performance  
17:35 <rstandy> those duplicates are strange, don't know why they appear  
17:36 <vmassol> rstandy: that looks like a bug, I can reproduce  
17:36 <vmassol> would be nice if you could create an issue at http://jira.xwiki.org  
17:36 <vmassol> but I still get the desired result  
17:37 <msmeria1> has quit  
17:38 <rstandy> ok, thank you very much for your help  
17:39 <rstandy> uhm uhm  
17:39 <vmassol> ?  
17:40 <rstandy> I encounter the problem also bypassing apache2  
17:40 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
17:40 <rstandy> but before issuing a bug, I'll start blank with my Vagrant box  
17:41 <rstandy> before customizing XWiki  
17:41 <rstandy> so to be sure  
17:41 <vmassol> ok thanks for your help in debugging the issue :)  
17:41 <rstandy> thank to you for your help and time  
17:43 <rstandy> I should be back with a fresh install of XWiki in a few minutes  
17:43 <rstandy> if my ansible playbook works...  
17:43 <vmassol> nice  
17:44 <rstandy> I hope to contribute the playbook to the community as soon as I'll convert it in an ansible role without my company specific configs  
17:45 <vmassol> that would be nice!  
17:45 <rstandy> would love to contribute back to this community  
17:55 <rstandy> while ansible works for me, I have another question:  
17:55 <rstandy> do people uses clojure with XWiki?  
17:55 <rstandy> for example as a scripting language for the scripting engine?  
17:59 <rstandy> would love to use my clojure experience in the XWiki platform  
17:59 <vmassol> rstandy: I don't know but it would be nice and easy to add  
17:59 <vmassol> actually is clojure supports the scripting api then it's supported by default :)  
17:59 <rstandy> wow!  
18:00 <vmassol> JSR223  
18:00 <rstandy> that's a nice news  
18:00 <vmassol> you just need to drop the jar in WEB-INF/lib and you're good  
18:00 <vmassol> then you use the {{script language="clojure"}} macro  
18:00 <vmassol> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Script+Macro  
18:00 <rstandy> supercool!  
18:01 <rstandy> I can't wait to try it!  
18:03 <rstandy> in the meantime I have a brand new XWiki instance to test :-)  
18:17 <fitz\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:19 <rstandy> the problem appear also with my freshly installed version of XWiki  
18:20 <rstandy> so I think I'll create the issues on the bug tracker  
18:22 <fitz> has quit  
18:22 <lkrejci> has quit  
18:22 <rstandy> 2016-03-30 18:20:12,593 [Active Installs Ping Thread] WARN  a.i.c.ActiveInstallsPingThread - Failed to send Active Installation ping to [http://extensions.xwiki.org/activeinstalls]. Error = [UnknownHostException: extensions.xwiki.org: unknown error]. Will retry in [86400] seconds...  
18:24 <vmassol> rstandy: that's ok  
18:25 <vmassol> that just mean your xwiki instance couldn't communicate with extensions.xwiki.org  
18:25 <vmassol> it's used to compute this: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ActiveInstalls/  
18:26 <vmassol> (see also http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Active+Installs+Client+API )  
18:26 <vmassol> gtg (train to take)  
18:27 <vmassol> has quit  
18:28 <rstandy> thank you again and have a nice evening vmassol!  
18:34 <Pbas> Hi, may I a quick question (if someone still left)?  :P  
18:35 <rstandy> please go ahead  
18:35 <Pbas> ho it is a groovy script :-)  
18:36 <Pbas> question  
18:36 <Pbas> I managed to list group members in groovy script  
18:36 <rstandy> I'm relatively new to XWiki...  
18:36 <Pbas> I found (a little bit randomly) syntax to call xwiki.rightsmanager.getAllMembersNamesForGroup("MyGroup") but now I want to distinguish group from user.  
18:37 <Pbas> May be there are someone else who know answer :-)  
18:37 <Pbas> I must xwiki.getDocument and MyUserOrGroup.getObjects(' XWiki.XWikiUsers')  or do you have a nicer way?  
18:39 <rstandy> don't know  
18:39 <rstandy> but maybe this would be useful to me and you:  
18:40 <rstandy> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Scripting+Documentation+Application  
18:40 <Pbas> ok it doesn't matter  
18:41 <Pbas> Thxs I use this one http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ScriptingDocumentation and old one to for velocity script http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/SRD/Navigation  
18:42 <Pbas> but I'm starting with groovy script :-/  
18:43 <rstandy> ok, sorry can't help  
18:43 <rstandy> I can't  
18:43 <Pbas> ok np  
18:43 <Pbas> thxs anyway  
18:43 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:58 <fitz\_\_> has quit  
18:59 <rstandy> Pbas: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ScriptingDocumentation?url=http:%2F%2Fnexus.xwiki.org%2Fnexus%2Fservice%2Flocal%2Frepositories%2Fpublic%2Farchive%2Forg%2Fxwiki%2Fplatform%2Fxwiki-platform-wiki-user-script%2F7.4.2%2Fxwiki-platform-wiki-user-script-7.4.2-javadoc.jar%2F!%2Forg%2Fxwiki%2Fwiki%2Fuser%2Fscript%2FWikiUserManagerScriptService.html%23isMember(java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String)  
19:00 <rstandy> Pbas: it seems what you need  
19:02 <Pbas> I will give it a try ty

21:23 <slestak> i am using xwiki v8, java 8 (0.34 i think), tomcat 8 on server 2012
